Title: neon heap-based buffer overflow
Synopsis:
A vulnerability potentially allowing remote execution of arbitrary code has
    been discovered in the neon library.

Background.Text: neon provides an HTTP and WebDAV client library.

Description.Text: Stefan Esser discovered a vulnerability in the code of the neon library : if a malicious date string is passed to the ne_rfc1036_parse() function, it can trigger a string overflow into static heap variables.

Impact.Text: Depending on the application linked against libneon and when connected to a malicious WebDAV server, this vulnerability could allow execution of arbitrary code with the rights of the user running that application.

Workaround.Text: There is no known workaround at this time. All users are advised to upgrade to the latest available version of neon.

P.Text: All users of neon should upgrade to the latest stable version:
